abstract.text: Initializes a texture object with the specified image data and properties.

inlineContent.text: The texture image data. Pass
for subclasses of
that create their own texture data.
If
, the image data is organized such that its first pixel represents the top left corner of the image. If
, the first pixel represents the bottom left corner of the image.
A descriptive name for the texture. Use the
property to reference this name after initialization.
The texel dimensions (width and height) of the texture image.

The number of bytes between the first texel in a row of image data and the first texel in the next row. If zero, the texture does not support direct addressing of texels—this is the case for some compressed texture formats.
The number of channels per texel—for example, 1 for a grayscale texture, 3 for an RGB color texture, or 4 for RGBA.
The data format for each channel value per texel—for example, 8-bit integer or 32-bit floating point. For possible values, see
If
, the image data represents an arrangement of six square images, each of which is a face for a cube texture. If
, the texture is a single 2D image.
A new texture object.

abstract.text: Import, export, and manipulate 3D models using a common infrastructure that integrates MetalKit, GLKit, and SceneKit.
A descriptive name for the object.
A source of texel data to be used in rendering material surface appearances.
The data format for each channel value per texel.
Initializes a texture object with the specified image data and properties.
Options for the data size and type of texel channel values, used by the
Type to represent a Boolean value.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
